page.title: 02ECOLOGY. FIELD FLORA. WILLEY
page.content: As Willey encompasses mainly pasture land, wild flowers are plentiful and often rare especially in areas that have not been ploughed. Early in the year bluebells can be seen growing among the young bracken shoots and celandine are common. In the wet ground around Limebrook, marsh marigolds are followed by silverweed and butterbur, cuckoo pint, bird's foot trefoil, tormentil, coltsfoot, mayweed, harebells, chamomile & poppies. In many fields poppies, buttercups, dandelions, daisies and thistle are common. In the woods wild broom and heathers grow while many old trees and hedges support honeysuckle.
